Delayed diagnosis leads to more complicated management

Failure to treat dislocating hip disease leads to limping from the onset of walking, chronic pain and early degenerative damage.

properties.question: What is a potential consequence of delayed diagnosis of congenital hip dislocation in children?
properties.option_a: Immediate improvement in hip function without intervention
properties.option_b: Limping from the onset of walking, chronic pain, and early degenerative damage
properties.option_c: Rapid and complete natural healing of the hip joint
properties.option_d: Enhanced hip joint flexibility and strength
